items.sentence: I don\'t think that Tom knows what he needs to buy.

Tom stopped reading his book and looked up at Mary.
Tom teaches an undergraduate course in translation.
Tom wants to be the best person he possibly can be.
I wonder whether Tom will sign the contract or not.
I wonder whether or not Tom noticed the difference.
I thought that you said that you didn\'t trust Tom.
I thought you didn\'t know how to drive a forklift.
I thought that Tom was supposed to be in Australia.
Tom looks at the world through rose-tinted glasses.
I doubt if Tom would be willing to stop doing that.
I don\'t have enough cookies to give everybody one.
What makes you think Tom hasn\'t done that already?
What\'s Tom doing here? I thought he was in Boston.
Are you just going to sit here and not do anything?
Tom told himself that there was no reason to panic.
Put on a coat. If you don\'t, you\'ll catch a cold.

Tom is good at getting people to do things for him.

Tom said that you need to be here all day tomorrow.

I can\'t believe you\'re capable of harming anyone.
I think that Tom doesn\'t know how to speak French.
Aren\'t you still planning on going back to Boston?
Assuming this thing actually works, we\'ll be rich.

Tom thought Mary wasn\'t going to get into college.
Tom told Mary she shouldn\'t do what she was doing.
Tom has some good ideas he wants to tell you about.
Tom laughed before he realized Mary wasn\'t joking.
Have you ever heard of a custom as strange as this?

Did you have toast for breakfast yesterday morning?

I know what you\'re implying, and I don\'t like it.
